channel.title: project on Datafortress.cloud
channel.description: Recent content in project on Datafortress.cloud

item.title: Tech NEWS 2022-01-21
item.description: First details leak on Project Iris, Google’s next AR headset (3 minute read) Google is developing a new augmented reality headset that it plans to ship sometime in 2024.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-11-23
item.description: Android Messages update handles Apple iMessage reactions properly (2 minute read) Google Messages on Android can now properly display emoji reactions sent from the iPhone’s Messages app.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-11-19
item.description: Apple reportedly wants to launch a self-driving EV in 2025 with a custom chip (3 minute read) Apple has reportedly accelerated its timeline for Project Titan, its secretive autonomous electric car project.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-10-27
item.description: Uber jumps into Europe’s rapid grocery delivery market with 15-minute service in Paris (3 minute read) Uber and Carrefour have created a service in Paris that ships essential items to customers in as little as 15 minutes.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-09-17
item.description: Alphabet’s Project Taara laser tech beamed 700TB of data across nearly 5km (3 minute read) While Google shut down Project Loon earlier this year, some of the technology remained in development.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-05-25
item.description: Google now lets you password-protect the page that shows all your searches (2 minute read) Google users now have the option to add a password to their Web and Activity page.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-04-26
item.description: Disney Imagineering’s Project Kiwi is free walking robot that will make you believe in Groot (1 minute video) Project Kiwi is a small-scale, free-roaming robotic actor developed by Disney’s Imagineers.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-03-10
item.description: Amazon’s long-rumored Vesta home robot project details leak (2 minute read) Amazon’s project Vesta is a long-rumored home robot that features built-in Alexa, multiple integrated cameras, a display, and the ability to move around a home.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2021-03-05
item.description: Google’s leaked Project Wolverine could give you superpowers (2 minute read) Project Wolverine is a device from Alphabet’s X division that lets the user isolate audio to focus on a specific source.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-11-19
item.description: Apple will reduce App Store cut to 15 percent for most developers starting January 1st (5 minute read) Apple will reduce its App Store commission rate to 15 percent for developers who earn less than $1 million in annual sales per year from all of their apps.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-11-11
item.description: The 5 biggest announcements from Apple’s ‘One More Thing’ hardware event (4 minute read) Apple announced new versions of the MacBook Air, the 13-inch MacBook Pro, and the Mac mini at its ‘One More Thing’ live stream.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-11-03
item.description: Apple announces November 10 One More Thing event for ARM-based Macs (3 minute read) Apple has announced a third fall media event as expected.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-10-19
item.description: Nokia wins NASA contract to put a 4G network on the moon (1 minute read) Nokia has been awarded a $14.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-10-13
item.description: The Pentagon Wants Elon Musk to Yeet Cargo Around the Planet In an Hour (2 minute read) The Pentagon has contracted SpaceX to develop rockets to deliver packages around the planet in under an hour.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-08-03
item.description: ByteDance and Microsoft deal for TikTok to stay in the U.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-07-29
item.description: Apple threatens to remove Airbnb from App Store over virtual experiences commission (2 minute read) Apple has demanded a 30% commission for sales of online classes sold by Airbnb and ClassPass.

item.title: Tech NEWS 2020-07-07
item.description: Secretive data startup Palantir has confidentially filed for an IPO (2 minute read) Palantir is a secretive data and analytics startup that provides technologies to clients such as the US government.
